alert.note: Alert for Berkshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 29 at 2:44PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Massachusetts, including the following county, Berkshire. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 244 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pittsfield, Great Barrington, Lee, Lenox, Sheffield, Becket, Otis, Canaan, Sandisfield, Housatonic, Ashley Falls, Stockbridge, New Marlborough, Richmond, West Stockbridge, Monterey, Washington, Alford, Tyringham and Hartsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
